name: The Connaught

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay. Some reviewers comment this is expensive, and it is, but fairly priced for the quality of the property in a central London location. Tea and breakfast were very good, not exceptional, the bar is good especially if you like cocktails. Again, $16 USD for a drink is steep, but again, you are in London and if you are form the US get used to the dollar not being the big kid on the block any more. This will be our go to lodging in London moving forward.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: Happy freindly staff who know about service and keeping customers happy.
reviews.title: Unforgettable but bring ££££

reviews.text: Pool is nice, when you get in feels warm, can just float away..
reviews.title: A genuine attitude towards helping their guests have the best possible stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got the feeling nothing was to much trouble and they even managed to sneak the breakfast trolley into the room without waking me up! Unforgettable hotel.
reviews.title: Great place but a bit dissapointed

reviews.text: Excellent attitude from most of the staff, especially reception and the in house butlers. Some snobbery from the bar staff and service not good at all in the Espelette. Rooms are very small considering the price and the lack of any real lobby for guests to sit is a nuisance.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea at The Connaught is No Picnic!

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Connaught for 3 nights november 2011. It's really a great hotel, wondefull location , nice rooms and very very nice service. I only have one remark to make and that's the bar. The Connaught hotel has 2 beautiful bars but we couldn't get a table. We were 7 in total and we know that's a lot but in my opinion if you stay 3 nights and you book 4 rooms it is unacceptable that you can't have a drink at the bar in your hotel after a day of shopping.
reviews.title: Great hotel but problems with the bar

reviews.text: I often stay at Knightsbridge hotel but chose The Connaught this time around and was delighted with the stay from the warm, professional check-in to the comfort and spaciousness of room, a a handwritten welcome note, plus all of the automatic features in the bathroom. Breakfast in the main restaurant was delicious! Location in Mayfair is perfect walking distance to wonderful restaurants, shopping...and the Aman Spa is very well done (although not of the standard of the Aman spas in Asia.
reviews.title: Liked Location, Loved Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just writing about our afternoon tea experience to help other people if you are undecided which hotel to choose. I was drawn to Connaught by the current afternoon tea menu on the Connaught/Esplette web page but unfortunately the menu we were offered on the day was altered (I was looking forward to the ginger scones and rose and raspberry cake, but sadly these were off the menu). The sandwhiches are average, with the exception of the chicken teriyaki paninis which were really lovely. We had been presented with 5 cakes on our stand and one rum baba, it was clear that these had been designed and made with care and skill and they tasted delicious, but with only one of each, we had to rather messily split them all in two. We were not offered any refills, in fact we felt rather rushed. I asked the waiter if I could order more than one type of speciality jam with the scones, and he reluctantly informed me that we could, but usually people were only allowed one! For me, afternoon tea is a treat, a decadent experience to enjoy and share. I don't want to feel rushed, or as if cakes are in short supply. For example, I asked the waiter if I could have an extra cake, and he replied that he would go and ask! After the scones, (the jams are delicious), you are offered a slice each of loaf cake, which again had to cut in two, but was dry.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea

reviews.text: All in all, it could have been so much better than average with just a little more attention to detail. When you are paying for a premium afternoon tea, you expect a high level of quality and service.
reviews.title: The best bar in London

reviews.text: I haven't stayed at The Connaught but it is now on my wish list. On this particular 'pub-crawl' round London we found ourselves in The Ritz. Hadn't intended to go to The Ritz. We'd intended to go to The American Bar at The Savoy but we kind of got lost and confused.
reviews.title: Disappointing afternoon tea

reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at the hotel as a special pre-baby/anniversary treat. It was fantastic! Beautiful interior, amazing service, great bars and restaurants, and fantastic spa. We got a complimentary upgrade to a luxury king room, in the modern part of the hotel. Lovely room, very high spec. Having a stroll around that area of Mayfair is great as well. I can't fault anything with the hotel. It is expensive, but as a special treat it was very much worth it. Go!
reviews.title: Wow, what a treat!

reviews.text: After visiting The Connaught seven times since its reopening I feel that I need to correct my original glowing review. The last visit was not a good one. I had it in writing a request for a non-smoking room. What did I get? A cramped room on the 5th floor with cigar smoke coming in under the connecting door. I was told that the 5th floor was declared a smoking floor by order of The Queen. I was not impressed. It was very difficult to change rooms & I had made reservation directly through hotel.
reviews.title: sorry but I need to correct my previous review

reviews.text: I had spa reservation in writing, but at arrival to spa they did not have my reservation. After much stress & calling of a hotel manager they did honor my reservation & did not charge me, but the whole thing was ruined. You can also hear the underground in treatment rooms.
reviews.title: Location perfect, stay great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I believe that hotel is poorly run. It cannot keep up with increase since opening of new wing. The owners have changed. Stains on the carpet, light bulbs burned out, drains smelly. There is a high turnover in staff and no top sheets on the bed just the duvet. Ugh!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, but do not book with one of the discount companies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked into the Connaught after having read reviews. Overall could not fault the service, room, amenities of the hotel. Only drawback was our room was not ready when we arrived, drink in the bar, had to wait a while, but we're given drinks which was good.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Connaught on multiple occasions over the past year and can wholeheartedly recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: It is the best hotel in the Maybourne Group - more up to date than Claridge's and better situated than the Berkeley. Please don't misunderstand me, both of those are fine hotels and if you specifically need to be in those locations then they will deliver with aplomb. The Connaught, however, combines both their qualities - the old worldliness and luxury of Claridge's with the modernity of the Berkeley. This success is, in part, due to the old and new wings of the hotel. If a more traditional 5 star hotel in the vein of the Dorchester or Claridge's is to your taste then opt for the old wing, the standard rooms do lack somewhat for space but the suites are a delight. I've stayed in the Carlos, Grosvenor, Connaught and Sutherland suites and would suggest each of them in an instant, however, in terms of value for money I would say the Connaught Suite wins out. The Sutherland Suite, as one would expect, is stunning but pricey.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Real value for money can be found in the new wing and if the more modern decor is to your taste, the junior suites are an absolute bargain and suitably spacious.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay - couldn't have picked anywhere better...

reviews.text: Service is impecable - I stayed for several weeks while unwell and the kitchen adapted the menu to my requirements. The butlers provide a discreet and amazingly high level of service - whether it's bringing bottled water, arranging for items from local pharmacies or just generally easing your stay. They never fail to deliver.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: The two restaurants at the hotel are excellent, as one would expect Hélène Darroze is stunning and I have reviewed the restaurant elsewhere on this website.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great experience!

description: Small, traditional hotel with tranquil atmosphere, multilingual staff; overlooking one of the most picturesque spots in Mayfair.
